intro: Diplusodon orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular diplusodon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its orbicular (rounded) leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
